36 /* Author: Michael Ferguson, Ioan Sucan, E. Gil Jones */
37 
38 #pragma once
39 
40 #include <moveit_simple_controller_manager/action_based_controller_handle.h>
41 #include <control_msgs/GripperCommandAction.h>
42 #include <set>
43 
44 namespace moveit_simple_controller_manager
45 {
46 /*
47  * This is an interface for a gripper using control_msgs/GripperCommandAction
48  * action interface (single DOF).
49  */
50 class GripperControllerHandle : public ActionBasedControllerHandle<control_msgs::GripperCommandAction>
51 {
52 public:
53  /* Topics will map to name/ns/goal, name/ns/result, etc */
54  GripperControllerHandle(const std::string& name, const std::string& ns)
55  : ActionBasedControllerHandle<control_msgs::GripperCommandAction>(name, ns)
56  , allow_failure_(false)
57  , parallel_jaw_gripper_(false)
58  {
59  }
60 
61  bool sendTrajectory(const moveit_msgs::RobotTrajectory& trajectory) override
62  {
63  ROS_DEBUG_STREAM_NAMED("GripperController", "Received new trajectory for " << name_);
64 
65  if (!controller_action_client_)
66  return false;
67 
68  if (!trajectory.multi_dof_joint_trajectory.points.empty())
69  {
70  ROS_ERROR_NAMED("GripperController", "Gripper cannot execute multi-dof trajectories.");
71  return false;
72  }
73 
74  if (trajectory.joint_trajectory.points.empty())
75  {
76  ROS_ERROR_NAMED("GripperController", "GripperController requires at least one joint trajectory point.");
77  return false;
78  }
79 
80  if (trajectory.joint_trajectory.points.size() > 1)
81  {
82  ROS_DEBUG_STREAM_NAMED("GripperController", "Trajectory: " << trajectory.joint_trajectory);
83  }
84 
85  if (trajectory.joint_trajectory.joint_names.empty())
86  {
87  ROS_ERROR_NAMED("GripperController", "No joint names specified");
88  return false;
89  }
90 
91  std::vector<std::size_t> gripper_joint_indexes;
92  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < trajectory.joint_trajectory.joint_names.size(); ++i)
93  {
94  if (command_joints_.find(trajectory.joint_trajectory.joint_names[i]) != command_joints_.end())
95  {
96  gripper_joint_indexes.push_back(i);
97  if (!parallel_jaw_gripper_)
98  break;
99  }
100  }
101 
102  if (gripper_joint_indexes.empty())
103  {
104  ROS_WARN_NAMED("GripperController", "No command_joint was specified for the MoveIt controller gripper handle. \
105  Please see GripperControllerHandle::addCommandJoint() and \
106  GripperControllerHandle::setCommandJoint(). Assuming index 0.");
107  gripper_joint_indexes.push_back(0);
108  }
109 
110  // goal to be sent
111  control_msgs::GripperCommandGoal goal;
112  goal.command.position = 0.0;
113  goal.command.max_effort = 0.0;
114 
115  // send last point
116  int tpoint = trajectory.joint_trajectory.points.size() - 1;
117  ROS_DEBUG_NAMED("GripperController", "Sending command from trajectory point %d", tpoint);
118 
119  // fill in goal from last point
120  for (std::size_t idx : gripper_joint_indexes)
121  {
122  if (trajectory.joint_trajectory.points[tpoint].positions.size() <= idx)
123  {
124  ROS_ERROR_NAMED("GripperController", "GripperController expects a joint trajectory with one \
125  point that specifies at least the position of joint \
126  '%s', but insufficient positions provided",
127  trajectory.joint_trajectory.joint_names[idx].c_str());
128  return false;
129  }
130  goal.command.position += trajectory.joint_trajectory.points[tpoint].positions[idx];
131 
132  if (trajectory.joint_trajectory.points[tpoint].effort.size() > idx)
133  goal.command.max_effort = trajectory.joint_trajectory.points[tpoint].effort[idx];
134  }
135 
136  controller_action_client_->sendGoal(goal,
137  boost::bind(&GripperControllerHandle::controllerDoneCallback, this, _1, _2),
138  boost::bind(&GripperControllerHandle::controllerActiveCallback, this),
139  boost::bind(&GripperControllerHandle::controllerFeedbackCallback, this, _1));
140 
141  done_ = false;
142  last_exec_ = moveit_controller_manager::ExecutionStatus::RUNNING;
143  return true;
144  }
145 
146  void setCommandJoint(const std::string& name)
147  {
148  command_joints_.clear();
149  addCommandJoint(name);
150  }
151 
152  void addCommandJoint(const std::string& name)
153  {
154  command_joints_.insert(name);
155  }
156 
157  void allowFailure(bool allow)
158  {
159  allow_failure_ = allow;
160  }
161 
162  void setParallelJawGripper(const std::string& left, const std::string& right)
163  {
164  addCommandJoint(left);
165  addCommandJoint(right);
166  parallel_jaw_gripper_ = true;
167  }
168 
169 private:
170  void controllerDoneCallback(const actionlib::SimpleClientGoalState& state,
171  const control_msgs::GripperCommandResultConstPtr& /* result */)
172  {
173  if (state == actionlib::SimpleClientGoalState::ABORTED && allow_failure_)
174  finishControllerExecution(actionlib::SimpleClientGoalState::SUCCEEDED);
175  else
176  finishControllerExecution(state);
177  }
178 
179  void controllerActiveCallback()
180  {
181  ROS_DEBUG_STREAM_NAMED("GripperController", name_ << " started execution");
182  }
183 
184  void controllerFeedbackCallback(const control_msgs::GripperCommandFeedbackConstPtr& /* feedback */)
185  {
186  }
187 
188  /*
189  * Some gripper drivers may indicate a failure if they do not close all the way when
190  * an object is in the gripper.
191  */
192  bool allow_failure_;
193 
194  /*
195  * A common setup is where there are two joints that each move
196  * half the overall distance. Thus, the command to the gripper
197  * should be the sum of the two joint distances.
198  *
199  * When this is set, command_joints_ should be of size 2,
200  * and the command will be the sum of the two joints.
201  */
202  bool parallel_jaw_gripper_;
203 
204  /*
205  * A GripperCommand message has only a single float64 for the
206  * "command", thus only a single joint angle can be sent -- however,
207  * due to the complexity of making grippers look correct in a URDF,
208  * they typically have >1 joints. The "command_joint" is the joint
209  * whose position value will be sent in the GripperCommand action. A
210  * set of names is provided for acceptable joint names. If any of
211  * the joints specified is found, the value corresponding to that
212  * joint is considered the command.
213  */
214  std::set<std::string> command_joints_;
215 };
216 
217 } // end namespace moveit_simple_controller_manager

std::shared_ptr< actionlib::SimpleActionClient< control_msgs::GripperCommandAction > > controller_action_client_
